subject: Tradeoff btw. right design and performance

Hi all,
I'm a newcommer of this board so the question I'm asking about might 
have been asked already and if so then sorry:-)

Let me start from an example.
There is a class building a XML-based report comprised of data 
gathered from a DB and other static data (let's say some 
report-scpecific data like header titles, date and so on). Reports 
may be very long and here two approaches arise. 
1. I guess that the classic design would be to separate gathering DB 
data from composing XML, but on the other hand, if a gatherer returns 
a collection of value objects from a DB and then a composer really 
builds an XML we waste memory. The example is not so teoretical cause 
I met users working somehow with MSWord documents of size 200Mb. If 
an XML report would have a like length then a server building several 
such request will simply die! 
2. Non classic solution is to return to a composer a recordset object 
and put on the composer's shoulders to fetch it, surround by specific 
info and put out. This resolves memory wasting problem but tights two 
different activities together.

Why I'm asking this question in JUint group is 'cause I started 
practicing JUint recently and one of my badly-designed classes 
happened to be untestable (cause of such thought copling).
As buffs of XP approach what do you preffer? Does it mean that every 
time a unit test can't be written for a function the function must be 
refactored?
